contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Musicians --> | name = Vicente Amigo | image = Vicenteamigo.jpg | caption = Vicente Amigo | image_size = | landscape = No | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = Vicente Amigo Girol | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1967|03|25}} | origin = [[Guadalcanal, Seville]], [[Andalusia]], [[Spain]] | death_date = | instrument = [[Guitar]] | genre = [[Flamenco music]], [[Jazz]] | occupation = [[Musician]], [[composer]] | years_active = 1988–present | label = | associated_acts = [[El Pele (singer)|El Pele]], [[Camarón de la Isla]], [[José Mercé]], [[Manolo Sanlúcar]], [[Merengue de Córdoba]] | website = {{URL|http://www.vicente-amigo.com/}} | notable_instruments = }} '''Vicente Amigo Girol''' (born 25 March 1967) is a Spanish [[flamenco]] composer and [[virtuoso]] [[guitarist]], born in [[Guadalcanal, Spain|Guadalcanal]], near [[Seville]]. He has played as backing guitarist on recordings by flamenco singers [[El Pele (singer)|El Pele]], [[Camarón de la Isla]], [[Vicente Soto]], [[Luis de Córdoba]] and the rociero band [[Salmarina]], and he has acted as a producer for [[Remedios Amaya]] and [[José Mercé]]. His album ''Ciudad de las Ideas'' won the 2001 Latin Grammy for the [[Latin Grammy Award for Best Flamenco Album|Best Flamenco Album]]<ref name="Harrigan">{{cite news|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?id=N38VAAAAIBAJ&sjid=f-sDAAAAIBAJ&pg=6624,151673&dq=vicente-amigo+grammy&hl=en|title=Alejandro Sanz takes top Latin Grammys in terror-delayed ceremony|last=Harrigan|first=Tom|date=1 November 2001|work=[[The Register-Guard]]|page=3D|accessdate=18 June 2013}}</ref> and the 2002 Ondas award for the best Flamenco work. == Biography == Although he is Sevillian by birth, he was raised and lives in [[Córdoba, Spain|Córdoba]], where he attended his first guitar lessons with [[El Tomate]] and [[Merengue de Córdoba]], and later, he improved his guitar playing with [[Manolo Sanlúcar]], with whom he worked for ten years. After a period of accompaniment which began alongside El Pele, he started to devote himself almost exclusively to playing concerts in 1988. ''De Mi Corazón al Aire'' ("From Out of My Heart", 1991) was his first record. An admirer of [[Paco de Lucía]] since childhood, Amigo took part with him in the show "Leyendas de la guitarra" (Legends of the Guitar) that was held in [[Seville]] as a foretaste of the Expo 92 exhibition, which also featured [[Paco de Lucía]], [[Bob Dylan]], [[Keith Richards]], [[Steve Vai]], [[Joe Satriani]], [[Nuno Bettencourt]], [[Phil Manzanera]], [[Joe Cocker]], [[Jack Bruce]] and [[Richard Thompson (musician)|Richard Thompson]]. By that time, he had already been awarded some of the most prestigious flamenco guitar prizes. Vicente Amigo is open to experimenting, pursuing Flamenco to unprecedented limits, and gaining in-depth knowledge about other forms of music, and sharing experiences with other artists. He has taken part in recordings by [[Khaled (musician)|Khaled]], [[Miguel Bosé]], [[Carmen Linares]], [[Manolo Sanlúcar]], [[Wagner Tiso]], [[Rosario]], [[Nacho Cano]], [[Alejandro Sanz]], [[Sting (musician)|Sting]], etc., and has shared the stage with the greatest of contemporary artists: [[Paco de Lucía]], [[Stanley Jordan]], [[John McLaughlin (musician)|John McLaughlin]], [[Al Di Meola]], [[Milton Nascimento]]. == Discography == # [[De mi corazón al aire]] (1991) # Vivencias Imaginadas (1995) # Poeta (1997) # [[Ciudad de las Ideas]] (2000) # Ciudad de las Ideas - en concierto desde Córdoba(Live DVD) (2004) # Un Momento en el Sonido (2005) # Paseo De Gracia (2009) # "Vivencias" La Obra Completa de un Genio (2010) # Tierra (2013) ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.deflamenco.com/artistas/veri.jsp?codigo=80 Vicente Amigo biography and discography at deflamenco.com] * [http://www.flamenco-world.com/tienda/autor/vicente-amigo/215/ Vicente Amigo biography and discography at flamenco-world.com] * [http://www.last.fm/music/Vicente+Amigo Vicente Amigo on Last.fm] {{Authority control|VIAF=43975053}} {{Persondata | NAME = Amigo, Vicente | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 25 March 1967 | PLACE OF BIRTH = Guadalcanal | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Amigo, Vicente}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:Spanish flamenco guitarists]] [[Category:Andalusian musicians]] [[Category:Latin Grammy Award winners]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Spanish composers]] [[Category:People from the Province of Seville]]
